website_summaries.verdict: A good high-end alternative for people looking for better speed and performance from a basic reader.
pros: Long cord design makes it easy to position the card reader around a workspace into the ideal location
High speed allows you to transfer movies in just seconds
Compatible with many tablets capable of using the USB device
cons: The card reader sometimes needs to be unplugged after restarting the computer to work again

customer_reviews.title: Great card reader
customer_reviews.text: If you’re an iMac user, this card reader is perfect! I realized that most often I had to pull my computer forward and turn it just to insert/remove my old memory card reader, this reader with the usb cable is invaluable. It’s also convenient to have SD, MicroSD etc all available at the same time without adapters or multiple readers. It’s also proven very fast so far. Granted I only took short video clips to test this, but transfering video was instant with the usb 3.0. I’m very satisfied with mine, and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rad AstronautTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works great <3
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem using this reader and find it very comfortable to use. It is literally connect and done, no drivers installed at all. I tried using more than one port at the same time (SD, SD pro-duo, and microSD) and had no problem whatsoever switching files in between all of them. It even comes with a cap for the usb port :) -My computer uses Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Tahira V.

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box,  mostly....
customer_reviews.text: It worked, then it didn't, then it did..ohh wait if I wiggle this wire it works. Turns out the Red (+5v) wire going to the USB Type A plug was busted and moving it just right made contact. Popped the card reader apart, de-soldered the old cable from the board, found a sacrificial USB 3 cable and soldered everything back up, some hot snot to keep it secure inside. Works with USB 3 speeds as advertised now. Yes I could have just returned it, but 15 mins of my time on a Sunday night wasn't that big a deal.
customer_reviews.author: 3dprnt

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one works fine
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE* Since Amazon refunded me for the one that smoked, and betting on the fact that the 1st one I ordered had a manufacturing defect, I got another one. This one works just fine--it works perfectly copying large RAW files directly from an SD card I have onto my computer for post-processing. The USB 3 speeds show a marked improvement over transferring over USB 2.0--much faster on the order of 1/4 of the time needed. I like the fact that this comes with a 12" cable instead of the 2" pigtail obligating you to buy an extension. Will keep this at 4 stars because the 1st one promptly smoked and died when plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst card reader I have used during my career
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. It's absolutely flimsy, impossible to feed cards. I have been a professional photojournalist for 25 years. This is the worst card reader I have used during my career !
customer_reviews.author: Astrid Riecken

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, not made to last.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for a year or two and today it stopped working. I tried multiple computers with multiple cards, and the end result was always the same: try to insert a card after it's plugged in, and the card does not register as inserted; try to plug the card in first, then plug in the device, and the device doesn't register as plugged in. Do not fall for all the glowing reviews, I am pretty sure a lot of recent buyers will realize they made a mistake somewhere down the road. My search for a good USB flash card reader continues.
customer_reviews.author: Tim B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked the first time... and never again.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. It worked fine the first time it was used. Then it sat in a drawer untouched for a couple months and now when plugged in, the power indicator light doesn't come on at all. Tried it on 3 different computers, multiple USB ports - none of them recognize that anything is plugged in, UNLESS I push down on the cable, just outside the connection. Then it powers on, but only as long as I'm manually applying pressure to the cable in one very specific place - which is not good for my USB ports. As soon as I release the pressure, it powers off and disconnects. Just very cheaply made I guess.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Completely Defective
customer_reviews.text: I tried this reader on three different Windows computers (Win 10, 8, and 7), with three different cards (two CF cards--which is what I'd bought it for--and one SDXC card) and both USB 2.0 and 3.0 ports. It was not recognized on any machine at all. There was no indication it was even plugged in. Highly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: M Rossmore

customer_reviews.title: Works for usb2.0, not the usb3.0.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to write bad reviews. Maybe I just got a rare defective one from the bad batch? I don't know. So here it goes: Works for USB 2.0, doesn't work for USB 3.0. Tried both Windows and Linux. Tried updating the firmware from the manufacturer's website. No luck, now doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: Bad Card Reader took 12 weeks and 11 e-mail exchanges to replace with a working reader
customer_reviews.text: I had to exchange 11 e-mails with screen shots, photographs, technical details, etc before the distributor put me through to the manufacturer and then, with additional correspondence with the manufactuerer, the manufacturer replaced the defective card reader with one that worked. I wish I had tested it when the first one arrived so I could have returned it to Amazon immediately, but I was having serious problems with my new Windows 10 PC during the Amazon return time window and did not try it until my PC was working properly and the Amazon return time expired.
customer_reviews.author: Claude L. Cornett Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent accessory
customer_reviews.text: Love it love it love it. Great price, great packaging. I prefer its cable connection to a box unit that plugs in directly because 1) this doesn't block off other ports around it; and 2) I can swing the box on its cord up closer for easier access. I love the speed. Cards and ports are now fast enough to edit HD video from external sources, such as a micro sdxc in this USB 3.0 reader. Doesn't require any additional power. Simultaneously accesses 2 micro sdxc cards with one in its dedicated micro SD slot, and the other in an SD adapter in the SD slot. USB 3.0 is SO much faster for read access and transferring data. Excellent accessory.
customer_reviews.author: S. Houchins

customer_reviews.title: Reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for several months now with daily, heavy use . . . and it's holding up beautifully with no bent pins. It's a relief to have a Card Reader you can depend on - thank you UGREEN! The only negative I would point out is that it tends to get warm on the bottom, so much so that it left a little faded mark on computer table. So, I would recommend lifting it up a bit to let air circulate around it. Even, with that minor issue, it's still a 5-Star Item. with great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Shores

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd paid attention to the one star reviews before buying this. I put in an SD card and have the same issues as others have posted about having intermittent loss of the ability to read the card. Also, the transfer rates are no where near USB 3.0 and so far are closer to USB 1.0.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not work on new (March 2019) Samsung PC
customer_reviews.text: This did not work on my relative new Samsung NP900X3T-KO2US. This excellent laptop has two 3.0 USB ports. The devise blue light came on but, my laptop did not recognize it at all and did not read the card (a Sandisk SDHC 16GB card). I trouble shot both using web suggestions and through Amazon tech support. Perhaps I just got a defective one devise and must have since the reviews are so stellar.... right?! Oh well. In typical unsurpassed customer service fashion, Amazon agreed to the return the devise even though I already threw away the box. Could not believe something as simple as this would be defective.
customer_reviews.author: bhart

customer_reviews.title: Needs more power than it should, or something else is an issue.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old one that fell apart. I plug this into a small unpowered hub that only has 4 USB software keys like iLock etc. The old one worked fine but this one doesn't;t work plugged into that. I unplugged that small hub and plugged it into the cable (It's connected to a multipart, high powered hub) and it still didn't;t work. I had to plug it directly into my laptop for some reason. The blue light illuminates but the memory card never mounts.
customer_reviews.author: R. Havok

customer_reviews.title: The best multi card reader for the price
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought this multi card reader I didn't know what to expect. After using it for over a year, I can say this is the best multi card reader for the price. No issues whatsoever. I now own 3 of them. I noticed that one of my 3 card ready has a bend pin for the CF card ready, I have no idea how that happened so I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5
customer_reviews.author: Marc101

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: So....first...yes...it works... but that's about all I "like" about the product. The cord is far and wide out of proportion to the receptacle (which is light plastic). The cord heavy and very unwieldy, so I need to keep it slightly wound with a twist tie. That's the only way I can store. I gave it Two Stars" because I needed it, it works...otherwise or I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: hamr

customer_reviews.title: Another failure
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: A prompt response was received from the seller and the problem was graciously resolved promptly. Very satisfied. This unit was purchased on 2 Sep 2018 and worked superbly until about two weeks ago. Now it will not read CF or SD cards. Four different CF and two different SD cards tried in both 2.0 and 3.0 ports. I have sent the seller an email and will revise this review dependent on the seller's response. Does anyone know of a card reader that will last more than a few months? I have tried four or so readers from the inexpensive to the expensive and none of them has lasted more than a few months to a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Evans

customer_reviews.title: Short cord, but works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for transferring photos from a Canon 80D to my PC for processing. It's fast and portable, no complaints. The USB cord is pretty short, about a foot, so you'll want to plug it into the front USB ports of your PC. On a laptop you shouldn't have to worry, but a tower PC would be a bit of a pain to use this reader if it were plugged into the back.
customer_reviews.author: Scott BlackTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent connection with computer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the card reader to replace my old card reader as it keeps getting hot after 2 minutes of use. After using the UGREEN SD Card Reader, I found that it keep disconnecting and connecting on my computer and Macbook. I tried all of the ports on my computers and the issue still persist. I can barely transfer a clip from my dash camera microSD card without it just cutting out. All in all, the build quality is good but the hardware just does not work consistenly enough for me to even recommend it and use it.
customer_reviews.author: PMA

customer_reviews.title: As simple as plug-and-play
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a simple and basic product. The material of the cable is as standard of a USB cable as you'd expect. It feels standard and not that cheap plastic feel some cables can feel. The box itself is plastic, part of it is a smooth feel and the other parts are a matte feel. It's a very modern product that does a very basic thing. Transfer speeds are much faster than I expected. I can transfer a 300MB file from my SD card to my computer through this device in about 10 seconds. (Provided it's plugged into a USB 3.0 port.) I recommend this product, as it's small, simple and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: I can read my Canon CF card
customer_reviews.text: I used to be able to directly connect my iMac to the Canon Rebel XT with its CF card. But that changed when Apple decided it didn't need to make it 'just work' anymore as one of its OS upgrades. This little card adapter reader was just what I needed. I was able to transfer photos again from my Canon's CF card into Mac OS Photos app using this adapter. Some folks don't upgrade cameras so quickly and as with most technology everything changes pretty fast. This was an inexpensive adapter that will provide a useful bridge until I decide to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: TechConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and pins broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: Favorable reviews I saw before purchasing this seem suspicious now. It was fairly light and flimsy from the get go, but I figured all it needed to do was accept cards and connect them to the computer. But pins broke or bent while routinely inserting a CF card within the first dozen attempts, something I've never seen happen before. Don't know if it's because the slot was not engineered to tight enough specs for the card to align with the pins or what, but it means all of the money I spent on this reader was just thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: William Pate

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with XQD
customer_reviews.text: This card reader is a sponsored product when searching for 'XQD' reader and is also advertised as a companion product when buying the XQD card so naturally, I purchased it without fully reading the details. It does not actually work with SQD cards! I can't attest to the quality of the actual product but the advertising is misleading, Amazon should fix this issue or the company should be more careful in how they are placing there ads so that people like myself don't end up being sold a product that does not work for the product it's paired with.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Great card reader!
customer_reviews.text: Great little reader. Bought it to replace another older type reader that was getting glitchy. Haven't had a problem yet. What I like about this unit is, when I use with my Apple computers, is that it brings up the files (photos, etc) as a separate drive (as it should). You can therefore make your decision as to where you'd want to store your new files. In the past, my older reader seemed to have made a devil's pact with iPhotos exclusively and I would have to work through it with no choice in the matter. Now, the choice is back in my hands. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: HipV

customer_reviews.title: Works Incredibly Well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after one of my cheaper card readers had failed on me- assuming it was because I began to use larger CF cards (32 GB) and it was just unable to read that kind of size, and when it did, it would create glitches on my images. But this one works well and so far I’ve had zero problems! It’s heavy duty, which is just what I prefer when it comes to something as expensive as photography, whether it’s your career or you’re just a hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: MAquino

customer_reviews.title: its recognized
customer_reviews.text: Not a driver issue, just wont read any cards. I tried an off brand and paid the price. Bought a san disk product for twice the price but it worked. THis was a let down, but i get you get what you pay for. I gave it one star because the computer sees it. Blah, dont waste your money. I didnt bother sending it back because packaging was thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest car reader for CF
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive, fast multi-card data reader. It's not the best, however. I use mostly CF cards and the reader seems picky about loading the card to my Mac. Pulling the card out and reinserting it sometimes works, but more often I have to unplug and replug the reader for my Mac to recognize the card. It has a small blue light that indicates its plugged in, but there is no indication of the card being read or data being transferred (other readers a light turns on and flickers to indicate transfer). This is more of a convenience thing, though. I just wish it worked more reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Be careful; do not download their driver update
customer_reviews.text: Initially, product was unstable, not showing all pictures on my Compact Flash card, using the blue USB port on my Windows 10 Lenovo laptop. UGREEN support suggested trying another USB port and to download their driver update. The other USB port (non-blue) on my computer worked, but after downloading and installing their driver, this did not work on any USB port. Ultimately tried to remove the driver, but uncertain I accomplished that. Returned the device.
customer_reviews.author: WonderDog

customer_reviews.title: Fast reader, handles CF cards nicely
customer_reviews.text: Liked this reader. Purchased to replace an older one with bent pins on the CF slot. The slot on this reader is longer, so seems likely that it will have less of a problem with misalignment. The reader is nice and fast if you have a USB 3.0 port, but backwardly compatible if you do not. Looked at many, many readers that handled CF (and other) cards, chose this one, and pleased with the choice for price and performance,
customer_reviews.author: Tula Holic

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected with minor issue.
customer_reviews.text: I have only plugged SD cards in it, and the only issue is that there is not much contact pressure.There is no tactile feel that the card has engaged the contacts. I have had to remove and re-insert cards a few times to get it to work. USB 3.0 transfers photographs much faster than my old USB 2.0 reader, so I am satisfied with that. If I needed an other one, I would would try an other brand because of the contact issue. For now it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: tljidaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worked for one file transfer at USB 2.0 speeds
customer_reviews.text: Bought this reader based on reviews as I'm a photographer with a need for a very reliable card reader with USB 3.0 speeds, this seemed like a great deal, very nice packaging and nice aestectics. But that doesn't mean it works as advertised, was able to complete one file transfer of 1.5 gb from a sandisk extreme pro 64gb card, max speed was 30mb/s. Attempted another file transfer from a different card and now it wont read either card. Might have got a dud, but wont be buying again as I need something reliable!
customer_reviews.author: L Moran

customer_reviews.title: MicroSD card slot stopped working after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: My MicroSD slot stopped working after 2 years of use, which isn't that bad considering the low price. I never liked that the MicroSD and regular SD card slots were stacked on top of each other, and I did not like the fact that there was no push-to-click feature in any of the slots. Sometimes figuring out the orientation of how I needed to insert the SD cards was also a pain. A somewhat awkward device to use but it does get the job done. I don't think I'll buy another one though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A Great Reader
customer_reviews.text: This reader replaced a unit that had Maxell's name on it, likely as a promotional item; while the older device worked, it would periodically lose its connection with my Windows 10 laptop and my Surface 3, probably due to an issue with its cable. The Ugreen feels solidly constructed with a nice thick USB 3.0 cable; once I plugged into my devices, it was instantly recognized and configured. Its connection remains solid as a rock, and it read my SDHC cards from both of my cameras without any issue. What more could I ask?
customer_reviews.author: DMA

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 year of use. This is the 2nd one that has done this.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd unit that has stopped working after about 1 year on me. Tried it on different busses and PCs -- it just stopped working. Dead in the water. I'd glady take a replacement or repair if offered, but for now, 2 is 2 many short lived SD card readers from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Halocene

customer_reviews.title: GREEN SD Card Reader USB 3.0 Card Hub Adapter 5Gbps Read 4 Cards Simultaneously CF, CFI, TF, SDX
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to read my camera's SD card on my Linux workstation. This works well with Linux, no issues recognizing the device using Ubuntu Linux. It is fast enough for my use, I don't find myself waiting to view an image but did not try any speed tests yet. The black box has slots for several different memory cards. The black box has a bright blue light on it that stays lite when plugged into the USB slot. It does not get warm when plugged in. The cord is about 20" long.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on SDXC and SDHC card
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine because of the rave reviews on Amazon. Once I got the card reader, I wasn't able to insert my SDXC card into the slot marked SD. I don't know what's going on. Doesn't anyone else have this problem or is it just me? I didn't force the card into the slot, but I did try numerous times to fit the SDXC card into all the possible slots, but none of them fits the SDXC or the SDHC card. My SDXC and SDHC cards are made by SanDisk in both 64GB and 32GB capacities. What's going on?
customer_reviews.author: Wen Tsen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty packaging but lacking tech support
customer_reviews.text: After waiting more than two weeks for the device to arrive, I was really disappointed to find that it did not read any of the SD memory cards that I tried. Probably because Windows 10 did not recognize the device. Drivers are not available from UGREEN because some strange app is needed for this device to run. The tech support phone number is not in the US which means it will probably cost more money to contact tech support than the device is worth. . What ever happened to Plug-n'-Play? I believe UGREEN (like many Chinese companies) knows that customers won't bother to return low cost devices for a refund. I won't be purchasing from UGREEN again.
customer_reviews.author: JohnW

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1year
customer_reviews.text: The manner it failed was it suddenly started saying anything inserted into it was considered write protected, meaning, for example, I could not deleted anything on a card inserted into the reader. There were no computer or card (the same issue was on any card I tried) setting changes and I tried *many* suggested solutions found online for the same problem. I ended up replacing this reader with a $6 model that works, i.e., my computer no longer says the cards are write protected.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: My computer would not read an important card...this card reader did!
customer_reviews.text: What else can I say except this really worked well. I had very important images on a card and, for some reason, my computer could not identify this particular card and read it. The card reader read it immediately after plugging it in. It is a well engineered device that is small but reads a wide variety of cards. What price is it worth to read important data? Hundreds...thousands of dollars? I think that less than $16 is an exceptional value. Thank you for saving my bacon!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Works out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to review SD cards from vehicle dash cams. Plugged it in, Windows 7 PC registered and installed the device within a couple seconds, and there was no trouble reading the data. Miscellaneous note; the micro reader does work like most devices, where the card is fully housed inside and ejected with a press/spring action. The card only goes in far enough to read the chip face and then pulled out. No problem whatsoever but what you should expect.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: One of Two Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a card read for the compact flash memory I have for my camera. Bought two of them, but sadly one had a bent pin for the Compact Flash part of the card reader. Since this was the whole purpose as I needed a card reader it was disappointed that one of the two was defective. With that exception the card reader does very well reading all the different memory I have tried. It is convenient to have all the different memory slots in one device rather than looking around for adaptors that I often misplace.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.  Nice design, but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This card reader works well as expected. I love the sharp-cornered design, bisected with matte and shiny quadrants on the top, with a blue LED where they intersect. Classy looking. One complaint is that the cord is fairly heavy (not necessarily a bad thing), but the light weight of the reader makes it kind of flop around. A bit more weight on the reader might keep it in place on the desktop. Works fine, though, with all the cards I tried on it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Paulsonn

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, To Be Determined
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a device that would last as my Laptop doesn’t have an SD card reader. I’ve purchased h asked others in the past with even exceptional build quality only for them to fail over time (months). This was one I found reading reviews online and here’s hoping it lives upto working longer then a year. Side note, when left plugged in Windows detects it as disconnecting and reconnecting every 10 minutes or so when not in use so make sure to disconnect when you’re done.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Strobeck

customer_reviews.title: Short cord. Best for laptops. Micro SD card grip very tight.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this reader to replace one whose contacts were going bad. I didn't realize that the USB cable is permanently attached to the device. This made desktop use difficult. Also, the micro SD card slot, the main reason I purchased it for, has a very tight grip on the card. Almost to the point of scraping the gold fingers on contact. I'd still reccomend this for mobile use, but ended up exchanging this for one that better suited my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Obigwan

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my Panasonic FZ-300
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the SD cards out of my new Panasonic FZ-300 camera. It also handles every other type so it is a nice little reader to have. I have it attached to a 3.0 USB in the back of my ITX case and it is Velcroed to the top right side... You can not even tell it is there. I can drop any type of SD card in it now and it can be read fast and without issue. I recommend this for anyone who needs a High End card Reader with a short cord.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent product. It takes several different kinds of cards so its well adaptable to what you may need. I have gone straight into the micro SD at times and used an adapter other times. The ports I used read and wrote well and fast. The only thing that's preventing me from giving five stars is because of a minor flaw that causes my port to not register it at times. I found that this seems to happen most when I have the reader plugged in when I do a restart or fresh power up. This doesn't happen when coming out of sleep mode.
customer_reviews.author: Kaochoy Saechao

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Short cable.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. My previous card reader decided that it would corrupt every file copied from the compact flash card, resulting in me losing EVERY photo and video on the card when I MOVED the files instead of copying them from the card to the computer! This one works well. I wish the USB cable was longer, it's only about 1ft, so not long enough to put the reader on the desk above the computer. The cable is permanently fixed to the reader.
customer_reviews.author: Jyunte

customer_reviews.title: Ugly Under Powered Device
customer_reviews.text: This is big and ugly so I thought maybe that is what UGreen had to compromise on to get it to do USB 3.0 speed. Well, wrong as this does not even perform at the rated USB 3.0 speed. Read speeds using this device tops out at around 95 MB/s and write speeds are much slower. Tried different high speed card but they all topped out at the same read and write speed. I was able to get better speed on other cheaper and smaller SD card reader. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: GGG from SF

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, but does not reconnect.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it with Windows 10 and it transfers data from SD cards very quickly, about 30 MB/S. The only problem with this unit is it does not reconnect automatically after restarting or powering up the computer. I have to unplug it and then plug it back in for it to be recognize and show up in Windows Explorer.
customer_reviews.author: johns18

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality Card Reader
customer_reviews.text: Let me just get to the negative because otherwise, it works great. The cord is a bit stiff which is good for durability but can make it awkward to get it to sit where you want it. The other negative is that SD card slot is mounted upside down so basically this is cancer if you are OCD. Other than that it works great and has never given me trouble
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Worked to get pfsense installed on Watchguard XTM 5 series
customer_reviews.text: It worked great. I was easily able to format and or read the CF card. I used it with a 16gb ÇF card (overkill) to install pfsense. Then I used the newly installed pfsense on the CF card and swapped out the original cf card that came with the Watchguard XTM and connected an SSD drive to load pfsense onto the ssd. That was the long and safe way to have pfsense running on. Watchguard XTM 5 Series firewall for homelab use.
customer_reviews.author: Nasir

customer_reviews.title: Wired = prevents breakage
customer_reviews.text: We specifically sought out a wired card reader as opposed to a direct-connect-to-the-port type card reader as the later risks breakage of not only the card reader but the port on the computer as well. This product was exactly what we were looking for and provides a lot of options for compatibility. Worked out of the box with Windows 10. Five-stars!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: DOA Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell, this card reader was Dead On Arrival (DOA). My evidence is that nothing happened when I plugged the USB into mi iMac and the put a micro-SD card in If it. If it had an LED on-light, it would at least confirm that it's plugged in, but the lack of this feature gives me no way to troubleshoot the problem. And because it came with no documentation of any sort, I have nothing else to dry.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Holmes, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I love my new card reader!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Canon EOS Rebel that uses the old, large, compact flash (CF) card. My new laptop won't accommodate a CF card so I purchased this four-card reader. I love it. Within minutes of receiving it I plugged it in and inserted (carefully) my CF card. You'll want to be gentle with this type of electronic because the pins are micro sized and fragile, so be gentle with it. Lightning fast. Very attractive construction.
customer_reviews.author: AJL

customer_reviews.title: Quirky when booting from SDcard through this device
customer_reviews.text: I have a tablet computer that only has 1 usb port which can be either used for USB devices or charging the battery, but not both. This device worked pretty good for putting in multiple SD Cards. But when I created a bootable SDcard for running another OS or diagnostic The card created wouldn't boot. If I created a bootable USB drive and plugged it directly or an external multi USB hub, it would boot. So head's up, nerds.
customer_reviews.author: Old Surfer Dude

customer_reviews.title: UGREEN makes reliable products. This is absolutely a workhorse and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I have other UGREEN products (a USB switcher for keyboard/mouse to use on multiple computers) and really love this brand, used this for almost a year now daily for my DSLR and mirrorless camera file transfers, prefer it over wireless with the Canon software for my EOS 6D and EOS R. Drop dead reliable and stupid easy to use. Never had a single problem and it rattles around in my gear bags and again has daily use. Don't hesitate if you need a card/USB file transfer device. This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gilman

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today, as quoted. It was packaged well. I was concerned since I never heard of this brand before. I bought it to replace an older SanDisk card reader that could not read SD HC cards. I opened it up, plugged it in and inserted an SD HC card from my C-PAP machine. It read it immediately and I was able to import the data into my software. I am very pleased. It seems sturdy and I like the black color and nice squared off design. I hope this lasts a LONG time.
customer_reviews.author: DerSchuhmacherTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Reads it All
customer_reviews.text: Bought another popular reader on here and it was junk and only read an sd card. This one works great! I was able to read all of my memory cards. I tried the following types: microsd, sd, memory stick, cf. It read and wrote to them all and with the nice usb 3.0 speeds when the card supports it. Small size, hard wired cord which is nice and I like its shape as it sits upright on my desk by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This product is only good for reading media
customer_reviews.text: I've attempted twice to save data to a memory card inserted and connected to this device and it does not save data. Reads fine if data is saved by another device such as a laptop or camera, but saving directly to from a laptop seems not to work
customer_reviews.author: tomb523Top Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Fast
customer_reviews.text: This card reader makes it easy to read up to four memory cards at the same time. I bought it to replace my previous USB 2.0 CF card reader. But this new reader more than meets my expectations and needs. USB 3.0 is fast. Over 5 GB of files downloaded in less than 2 minutes. The one thing I wish it has is a longer cable. 30 CM is a bit short but that's easily overcome. To get started, I plugged it in popped in a CF card and I was able to access my files.
customer_reviews.author: texxasmike

customer_reviews.title: Works half the times
customer_reviews.text: Cord is relatively short but the build seems fine. The SD card reader doesn't "click" when the card is inserted so you're never really sure when it's actually "reading". The main problem is half the times it simply does NOT work. Have to reconnect the USB a few times before it actually detects the SD card and then it will randomly just disconnect in the middle of a transfer. Not the most expensive option but I thought I'd spend a bit more than the cheapest options to get somewhat of a decent product. Unfortunately not the case this time. ** edit. Customer care was attentive and responsible.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this card.  It will make your microSD card unreadable
customer_reviews.text: I would give 0 starts but thats not a option. I had I high hopes for this multicard reader as it had 3800+ reviews with 4.5 stars. I had two microSD cards that I was going to back up with clonzilla. First one went great then after that any card I inserted (2 at this point 64GB & 128GB) into the reader either on Windows 10 or Ubuntu It then made the card only show 30 MB. Tried diskpart in windows 10. This only cleaned the 30 MB file and still only shows 30 MB. Cant format in Windows or Ubuntu. Ruined 2 sd cards for me. Would Stay away from this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stay away if you're a videographer / photographer
customer_reviews.text: This is for consumers who are transfering jpegs and small files to their computers. This item is trash and corrupted 50% of the files I needed to complete 2 major projects. 150GB of film and over 3,000 photos, gone. The project timelines expired and I did not have time to go back to shoot new files. If you are a film or photo professional. STAY AWAY from this item! You have been warned. I now have [pro]master reader which seems to work fine. The Ugreen unit was thrown in the trash where it belongs so that no one hopefully had to go through what I did. Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: In my experience, this did NOT do the job at all. First it failed to even show up on my MacBook Pro and when it eventually did, it would NOT open up my thumbnail photos, calling for the card(s) to be correctly formatted. Now I am wondering if it actually ended up corrupting my cards.
customer_reviews.author: AKD47

customer_reviews.title: Very slow.  Constant freeze during loadup.  Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: So the reason i give this 1 star is because the transfer speed is so slow that it freezes while trying to load a memory card. The build quality is decent, but for a 3.0 usb card reader and for the price this reader shouldnt have problems loading a disk with only 100 pictures on it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kim

customer_reviews.title: Worked good on small cards
customer_reviews.text: This will not work with any of my 32G cf cards, however it read the 16g great. I am disappointed as there is nothing in the description or instructions that state this card reader is for smaller cards. I did try multiple cards on different computers. Smaller ones read large pro cards do not
customer_reviews.author: Peri

customer_reviews.title: Decent card reader
customer_reviews.text: Decent card reader. Moves data much faster than the onboard SD reader in my laptop. Only real complaint is that they made it so the SD card goes in upside down if you have the reader right side up to see the blue light and label. So product looks nice, but I’ve never had to insert my card upside down to make something work before. Small thing, but overall it works great and transfers data very fast.
customer_reviews.author: RICH

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 1 year.  Prevented computer from working!  Had to unplug it and throw it away.
customer_reviews.text: While it worked, it did a fine job. In less than 1 year, it failed in a manner that it prevented the computer from working correctly! When it is plugged in, the computer does not work right. When I removed the SD card reader from the USB port, the computer works properly. Very strange- not sure I have ever seen this type of failure before! Do not buy this unless you only expect it to function a for short time period. Try another brand even if it costs a few more dollars.
customer_reviews.author: bkengineer

customer_reviews.title: Great for compact flash
customer_reviews.text: I had a store brand from Best Buy, it worked OK but pins that connect to compact flash card were difficult to engage when pushing in the card. Last week it failed completely and not knowing if the compact flash was defective or the reader I ordered UGREEN SD card reader. Not only did that solve the problem with my Compact flash card, it runs faster than the Best Buy unit. For the money this appears to be a great device.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: CORRUPTED MY CARD. LOST MY FOOTAGE
customer_reviews.text: One of The internal pins broke off, like most cheap card readers of the like. Now, during the dumping of footage, my card was corrupted and I lost all of my footage. Will be returning shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Johanan McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Did lots of research, landed on this one. Years later, still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this product opens up separate drives for each card plugged in, instead of only being able to do one port at a time. The build quality is great, has traveled all over the place with me! Did a lot of research and landed on this one and I'm happy I did. Owned for a few years now and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott Golden

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I connected this device to my HP PC and have had no problems in its function. Many times with other memory card readers they sometimes will connect and other times not connect. I will have to unplug USB cable from PC and reconnect to get a reading on the memory card that I had inserted. This card reader has not failed and I have not had to unplug it one time. Works great and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Great little card reader
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in order to share videos instantly from my CF camera card to a computer. It's a small, compact reader that fits in your pocket! It is a plug and play device, and can be used in both Windows and Mac computers. Don't look for Ugreen reader to pop up in devices/drives, though. It shows up as whatever card you've plugged in, for example, eos digital. Easily plays videos right from card, and allows quick copying for, card to PC. USB 3.0 allows for quicker operation and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B. MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Work decent.....when you can get them to read.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these readers is nice....except for its basic ability to read the CF card. The build quality, length of cord and low profile are desirable. However, I find myself needing to remove the card and insert it again with "ooomph" in order to get the card to read and mount on my desktop. You get what you pay for, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good speed
customer_reviews.text: For a while I endured the transfer speeds of my $2 card reader I got from the local discount electronics store. Friends recommended buying higher priced readers because "you'll see the difference". Bought this one instead, and cut my transfer speeds in half, if not more. Looks like a big difference to me, for a lot less. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: A must buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: A four memory card at the same time reader that is 3.0 and is less then $10 dollars. Only catch is it only holds one of each kind of memchips. Micro SD, SD and then the camera ones. Other cool thing is some camera mem cards have wifi built in plus awesome graphics or pic resolution with the speed too. I liken it to a 4 core with ram and wifi built in. Kinda like a choose your own adventure book ot PC build for cheep. Oh and you can swap them out and flash the memory all you want. Almost beats the hell outta of a CPU. Almost.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonCRich

customer_reviews.title: Overheating & Disconnects/ Reconnects Constantly
customer_reviews.text: Overheating & Disconnects/ Reconnects Constantly I purchased this item to read cards very rarely. I used it successfully twice after receiving this item in 2018. It has been stored safely since. Now in 2020 I've gotten it out to use for maybe the third time and it cannot connect. Device manager sees a flash of connection but looses it before you can interact with it. Device is also heating up to the point where I believe it would burn me or melt the card if left connected. I'm worried I've damaged my cards but I won't know until I can get another card reader. Avoid if you care about keeping your memories safe.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Ralli

customer_reviews.title: Nice USB flash card reader
customer_reviews.text: This works fine and is quickly recognized by my Windows 10 computers. It can handle multiple cards at once, and each card is assigned a drive letter. I've been using it at least 9 months now and have never had a problem with it. Having USB 3.0 is a must because it is much faster than USB 2.0. However it is compatible with USB 2.0 if your computer or device doesn't have an available USB 3.0.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The Reviews Were Correct
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card reader because the card slot on my Dell desktop stopped functioning. Our IT guru suggested that we buy a reader instead of trying to fix the problem. The Amazon reviews for this model were positive; and they were right. It works like a charm and was inexpensive. 5 Stars from this satisfied user.
customer_reviews.author: prudentmallard

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Windows 10, 7 not so much.
customer_reviews.text: This reader didn't work at all on the Windows 7 desktop. It seemed to work on the Windows 10 laptop. I use the desktop more than I do the laptop. This doesn't quite work for my particular needs. I'd give more stars if it worked on my Windows 7 desktop. I recently rebuilt the desktop due to a drive that failed, so it's definitely not my machine.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Young

customer_reviews.title: Works As Expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to transfer photos from a 16GB Compact Flash card to my 2017 Apple MacBook Pro. Connecting to USB 3 to to USB-C isn't ideal but the speeds are fast and reliable. No complaints on that part. I do wish it had a pluggable cable to the device as the one it came with is short (18in.) and is permanently attached. Would be nice to be able to swap cable types out from the device itself rather than daisy chaining cables. But honestly thats just a wish list thing. Overall good product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have it since just a few weeks, but work OK I bought to replace another (cheap) card reader that died after 2-3 months of use Small and compact, transfer speed seems to be more limited by the SD card read speed than the reader It gets kind of hot while in use, and stay warm if just left idle
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes I had to make sure there was a card in the unit before booting up stuff like that, so I took a chance and bought ...
customer_reviews.text: I used tp pwn a similar product from another company and it never worked right. Sometimes I had to make sure there was a card in the unit before booting up stuff like that, so I took a chance and bought this one and it just plain and simply works. Good transfer speeds and works every time! Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lawton W. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed!!
customer_reviews.text: I have SD cards and micro SD cards for various electronics that I needed to be able to read and transfer files from with my PC. I bought this and it was plug-n-play on the PC. The cord is pretty short but that isn't a deal breaker for me. It works perfect and it arrived the next day just after noon time. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected on Ubuntu 14
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected on Ubuntu 14. Connected through USB 3.0 PCIe card. Only tested SD card but speed seems quite good. The cord is long enough to reach from the back to the front, but just barely. There are no rubber feet on it so it slides around a little. Double sided tape to attach it to something should solve that. FYI, the device shows up in the "by-id" directory as "usb-Generic_STORAGE_DEVICE" for all of the connections on the device - it'd be nice if they showed as "SD_Reader", "CF_Reader", etc. like another I have. But that's how Linux handles the chipset, not related to this specific device.
customer_reviews.author: ktbos

customer_reviews.title: 40 mbps speed... rip-off
customer_reviews.text: I really believed that it would support speeds up to 500 mb/s. Im getting around 40 Mbps and I tried all of my cards (Sandisk extemePlus, Sony [300mbps]) and nothing got near that speed. it sucks when trying to move 20-30 GBs from an SD card to my SSDs and hard drives. Definitely don't buy. Find a better brand that has products that actually support their claims. I finally got the time to write this review after months of testing this. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Karim

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: It works awesome! I was a little skeptical about being able to read my old CF Card in my new MacBook Pro 2018 but this Card Reader work like it was meant to be. This allows me to still use as a backup and for some extreme situations my old Canon EOS Rebel XT and be able to get those photos into my laptop to be develop.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Araya

customer_reviews.title: The Hidden Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is uniquely designed. It has a lens the moves manually from straight forward following the body of the camera. Move it with your fingers to set in a breast pocket and just allow the lens to be exposed. Very clear videos and single shots. Lays in the palm of your hand nearly hidden.
customer_reviews.author: GManMi

customer_reviews.title: I can view an old SD card
customer_reviews.text: My mother found an old Kodak camera that wasn't working and I took out the SD card but I didn't have a way to read it. I order this reader from Amazon, it was here in 2-days, plugged it in, but in the SD card, and found some pictures of my father with my mother and others from a few years before he passed. My mother was happy to see the pictures!
customer_reviews.author: pinguin

customer_reviews.title: I believe this will be a more than great product to fill your needs
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I've used it to check if it can do simultaneous read of al the ports. It does, but it slows down a bit (not too much, though). The only thing I find an issue is the cable directly attached to the reader, I don't know how much it could last, but once it goes, it goes. As far as the uses, I believe this will be a more than great product to fill your needs.
customer_reviews.author: wakon

customer_reviews.title: Great option for reading CF Cards
customer_reviews.text: I use mostly CF cards with my cameras and this is a great option for reading those. Many of the card readers only read SD or mini SD cards where as this also reads the CF cards. Very fast, compact and feels very durable. Also like that its USB 3.0. Not that a couple of seconds saved makes that big of difference but its still nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, popped the memory card in ... and poof. Worked like a charm. It is ALL plastic, so don't expect a solid piece of equipment, but it works and that's all that really matters.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bel

customer_reviews.title: Works well Windows 10 and Ubuntu Linux
customer_reviews.text: Needed a CF reader for a Windows 10 notebook and also a SD and other card reader for Ubuntu Linux. Works well in both situations, and it's inexpensive. Just plug and play, no added drivers needed. Here to buy another so I can leave it plugged into my Linux desktop. Didn't use tech support so I didn't rate that.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Boyes

customer_reviews.title: Faster than my Built-In Card Reader!
customer_reviews.text: My built in multi-card reader on my my 3 year old computer went out and I needed a replacement on the fly. I bought this and plugged it into the standard USB 2.0 slot on the back, and right away I noticed it read the card and granted me access to the folder way faster than the old built in reader ever did. I'm talking a SD card filled with several GB of jpeg pictures and videos. I am very pleased with this device .
customer_reviews.author: rwlohmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: This item does exactly what it is designed to do, read multiple formats of memory cards. USB 3.0 wastes no time accessing the data on any format. Now I no longer have to find cables to connect items to the pc. Just remove the card, plug it in to the appropriate slot in the reader and that’s it.
customer_reviews.author: Kemosabe

customer_reviews.title: Short-Term Card Reader
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card reader in April 2018 and have been using it almost daily since. This week, a pin finally busted and now the reader will not work. For the price, it is still a good buy. CF card readers are notorious for bending pins and at least this one lasted a year.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Stultz

customer_reviews.title: Not USB 3 speeds
customer_reviews.text: This card reader *works*, has decent construction for the price, and the speed is decent. However it advertises 5 Gbps in both the product name and description, and it doesn't come anywhere close to that. I get about 30 MB/s (0.24 Gbps) when reading from a SanDisk 170 MB/s SD card.
customer_reviews.author: David Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Mac User? READ THIS.
customer_reviews.text: This helped me get pictures and video off my memory cards, however, my mac did not pick up the videos when opening up the folders. I knew they were on there because I could watch it on my camcorder. The way I worked around it was by opening iMovie. The program picked up the card as a Camcorder which allowed me to extract the videos. iPhoto will also work. If I didn't know this, I would have been stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Walton

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out item.
customer_reviews.text: I like it because my last reader had all the weight of the device handing on the USB connector. This one doesn't and the cable is long enough to plug anywhere and still have it positioned where you can use it. My only complaint is that it does not show activity when recording.
customer_reviews.author: FLMJ Goodyear

product_meta.title: UGREEN SD Card Reader USB 3.0 Card Hub Adapter 5Gbps Read 4 Cards Simultaneously CF, CFI, TF, SDXC, SDHC, SD, MMC, Micro SDXC, Micro SD, Micro SDHC, MS, UHS-I for Windows, Mac, Linux
feature_bullets: One Reader for Multi Cards: Ugreen USB Card Reader is designed with 4 card slots: SD, Micro SD, CF, MS slots and USB 3.0 connector, which allow you to read and transfer data the most popular flash media on the computer, laptop, tablet through USB 3.0 interface, including SDXC/SDHC/SD/Extreme I III SD/Ultra II SD/MMC/RS-MMC or Micro SD/TF/Micro SDXC/Micro SDHC/UHS-I or CF I 3.0/4.0 /Extreme I III CF/Ultra II CF/HS CF/XS-XS CF/CF Elite Pro/ CF Pro/CF Pro II or MS/MS PRO/MS PRO-HG/MS XC DUO.

Super Speed&High Capacity: Ugreen USB Memory Card Reader support SD/Micro SD card up to 512G and allows super fast data transfer up to 5Gbps - 10X faster than USB 2.0 (480 Mbps), which allows you to transfer HD movies or files in just seconds, when your host is equipped with USB 3.0 port. Also backward compatible with USB 2.0, 1.1 and 1.0 (speed limited by USB bus).

Compact Design&Premium Quality: So useful but so compact. Easy to grab and go. Reinforced cable, Tin-plated pure copper core and multi-shielded inside, sturdy exterior and heat-resistant connectors ensure high data transmission efficiency and ultimate durability. 1.5ft short cable tail would reduce stress on the USB port on your computer and won't affect the use of adjacent ports. LED indicator will be ON when the card reader is connected to computer.

Broad Compatibility: Compatible with Windows XP/Vista/7/8/8.1/10, Mac OS, Linux, Chrome OS and etc. It could read and write mutiple cards at the same time to keep you away from the hassle of constant unplugging and re-plugging.
One-sec Installation: Plug and Play. No driver needed. Hot swapping and auto detection.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,465 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
